name: Medieval mills & a ruined Victorian factory walk near Lizard Point

ai.summary: A short, easy coastal stroll near Lizard Point in the UK that combines history with sea views. The 1.4 km route passes medieval mills and a ruined Victorian factory, offering a pleasant, accessible walk along the coast.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly well-maintained coastal paths with some uneven sections, rocky edges, and a few steps. Expect exposed sea views, potential mud after rain, and a gentle, easy grade suitable for most walkers.
ai.safety_notes: Check tide times and weather before you go. Stay well back from cliff edges and avoid loose rocks. Keep children and pets under control. Wear sturdy footwear and bring a light jacket, water, and sun protection. Mobile signal may be limited in remote coastal sections.
recommended_gear: Map or offline GPS / fully charged phone
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (approximately Aprilâ€“October) offer the mildest and most enjoyable conditions for this coastal walk, with longer daylight in summer. Winter can be windy, cold, and less predictable.

seo.title: Medieval Mills & Ruined Victorian Factory Walk near Lizard Point - Easy Coastal Hike (UK)
seo.meta_description: Explore a short, easy 1.4 km coastal hike near Lizard Point, UK. This walk reveals medieval mills and a ruined Victorian factory with stunning sea views.
seo.h1: Medieval Mills & Ruined Victorian Factory Walk near Lizard Point
